release.description: This release of the Security Service is a component of the integrated release 2.2.0 of the PDS 2010 System. This is an operational release of the system components to date.
release.action: Removed the Release Notes document. This document now serves as the single source for release changes.

release.description: This release of the Security Service is a component of the integrated release 2.1.0 of the PDS 2010 System. This is an operational release of the system components to date.
release.action: Added the schema, group and person configuration files for the directory server.
Cleaned up the documentation and removed the PDF generation feature.

release.description: This release of the Security Service is a component of the integrated release 2.0.0 of the PDS 2010 System. This is an operational release of the system components to date.

This release of the Security Service is a component of the integrated releases 1.1.0 and 1.2.0 of the PDS 2010 System. This latest release is intended as a prototype release in support of the assessment of the PDS4 standards and the system components to date.
release.action: Removed the dependence on the OpenAM product due to its complexity and simply replaced it with the OpenDS directory server product.

release.description: This release of the Registry Service is a component of the integrated release 1.0.0 of the PDS 2010 System. This release is intended as a prototype release in support of the assessment of the PDS4 standards.
release.action: Enabled HTTP PUT and DELETE actions in OpenAM Policy definitions for Web URLs.
Restricted the access only to the members of the affiliate group.

release.description: This release of the Security Service is a component of the integrated release 0.1.0 of the PDS 2010 System. This release is intended as a prototype release in support of the demonstration at the Management Council Face-to-Face meeting in August 2010.
release.action: Provide the initial integration of the open source OpenAM product for satisfying the Security Service requirements.
Provide the initial configuration to utilize a separately installed OpenDS directory server.
Populated the directory server with the initial dump of PDS users from the PDS catalog.
Provide the capability to secure specific URLs for the Registry Service via its host Apache Tomcat server.
Provide the initial documentation covering the design, installation and operation of the software.
